It’s a crazy world.

We got introduced to the ladies, and I made mistake No 3, giving Jack first choice, he chose Lily who I had seen before and was pretty good, but I was after pastures new. Mistake No 4!

The verdict:
Premises  3/10 but no surprises there, that's part of the appeal 
Sex  don't know
BBBJ  3/10 cos I am being kind
Value for money  5/10 only because it was $65 for 30 mins

Howdy All,

I’ve been going to this dump for over three years now and bloody Lucy has been a thorn in my side for most of it.

My first punt here was during my salad days when I was young and green. I arrived here and the lighting was so poor I could have accidently selected my Mum from the line-up if she had been working in Sydney at the time.

In those days you’d stand in a little pitch black alcove to the right of the entrance and the ladies would pop out from behind a curtain for a nanosecond. In the darkness I saw a tall and slim Asian lady named Lucy and thought “She’ll do just fine”.

In the room where there was more light I wasn’t so overjoyed with what I had. Its’ not just that she’s a bit ugly, which she is, but she has a bit of a equine look about her. (Translation: She has a face like a horse.) Now, before the RSPCA gets worked up into a lather, I want it on the record I like horses. My Uncle Elmo and Auntie Fay used to collect figurines of horses both in porcelain and bronze casts. I would sit in their lounge room and admire them along with the paintings of horses on the wall. (Note: Their favourite singer was Hawkshaw Hawkins and I’d have none of him!) Also, many are the days I’ve lost a bundle on the nags at Randwick with nary a complaint on my part. The problem is I am not sexually attracted to horse look-a-likes.

Anyway, I vowed after being with her for an hour I could cross Lucy off my bucket list.

Now fast forward to last year. Times are getting tough. The economy is going to shit. Belinda Neal has anger management issues and K-Rudd seems to spend more time overseas than helping Mrs. K-Rudd spend all her dough. 12 Bellevue is feeling the pinch and Lucy must be also. I now find whenever I go to this joint Lucy puts more and more pressure on me to choose her.

I arrive at this place and Lucy would walk up and grab me by the arm and start to take me upstairs. She’d stand at the front of the line-up and would reappear at the end. Once the following conversation endued:

Lucy: You never choose me.
Jack: Who are you?
Lucy: Don’t act like stupid man why you no choose me?
Jack: That’s it.
Lucy: That’s what?
Jack: I am a stupid man!

I’d look at the head honcho Sasa and could see she had a facial expression that told me she was flummoxed by Lucy’s behaviour.

Finally I had enough and chose her from the line-up. I kid you not a cheer went up. I don’t know if that cheer meant they would put me in the Guinness Book of Records as ‘all time punter sucker’ or they were startled anyone in their right mind would select Lucy.

Let me be clear about a couple of things upfront. I had no intention of placing my gob on her gob in any way, shape or form. Second, I was not going downtown so there would be no daty.

They say that in the near future they will have robots that do sex. Well, it’s not in the future the prototype Lucy model is operating now.

Lucy did the works; there was bbj with cim, rimming, sex in every known position. It was all mechanical and by the numbers. Listen gents, I am not looking for a life partner, but a little behaviour outside the script is always appreciated by Jack.

I guess I got my monies worth, but it also jarred the memory of why I had not seen her again.

I hope I got Lucy off my back for awhile.

Post Title: 
 12 Bellevue and Yu-Yu
				
Post Content: 
Hi All,

(Kerouac bows his head in shame.)

I guess you know by now that as far as punting is concerned I'm a quantity over quality man. That's not really right. I mean we can disagree on aesthetics and neither of us is wrong. Let's just say I focus on the bottom end of the market.

I believe that brothels are much like restaurants.  You go into that upmarket restaurant and there is the beautiful wood panelling, the ambient lighting, the engraved plates and the trio playing 'It's Not Unusual' in the corner. There are no prices on the menu and when you receive your order of lobster mornay from the beautiful waitress it looks like a matchstick floating in a sea of yellow goo. You take a gander at the wine list and its prices and realise you'd have been better off having arrived already drunk so that your heart could stand the sticker price of that stuff. You came in hungry and left the same way. The only difference is you are now broke. In the dirty dive down the street they have an 'all you can eat' buffet for $10. The lights are florescent and would make Jennifer Garner look like a cadaver. The tables are laminex and all the chairs seem broken and the plates chipped. You go in looking like Brad Pitt and come out looking like John Candy, but you have a smile on your face, a full belly and coins in your pocket.

So, it all is with brothels. You go to the up market joints like Stiletto, The Boardroom and the Gateway Club and you get fancy decor. The line-up looks like the extras used in Baywatch. You select a blonde hottie and go into the room where you face that ambient lighting, the smell of fresh linen and showers with soap dispensers. Before she gets into the Jacuzzi with you she reads off an 'I don't do list' that stretches further than Kevin Rudd's unkept election promises. It takes 45 minutes of your hour just to hear that stuff and in the end she says 'I don't like you touching me like that!'

At Bellevue it is all cheap and cheerful. Everything is rundown and falling apart. The bed in the room sags, the towels a funny odour and the mirror is cracked. The line-up is a mirror image of the decor and at first you think they should be paying you, but the ladies literally bust their arses to please you. They tell you they 'want you to be happy' and they mean it.

Now, it's time to mention Yu-Yu. She is one of the old timers there. She is no oil painting. She will not be doing a setting for one of those effete, limp wristed characters with a soft voice and the cultivated affection of a lisp who enters the Archibald Prize. You know these blokes. They stand on street corners saying things to their mates like "Oh Nigel, that orange zoot tuit of yourth ith divine. Nexth time get a lime one instead of orange. My experience/comments:

Once your inside be careful if your eyesight is a bit dim beacause there are steps in lots of places where you might not expect like in the middle of the landings. The decor of the place is very run down, but just about acceptable. The rooms have hot showers and basic beds, usually a picture of a blond supermodel on the wall too. 
Would I recommend? Yes, but make sure you read a review or two of this place. If you want the great looking girls and luxury brothel set-up this is not for you but this is a great place to come for no-nonsense relief.
Will I return? Yes.

Howdy All,

Trust me all of this hangs together and hopefully makes sense.

Years ago, and I think it was in the book  On the Road, I read of an event that if I didn't know better had been stolen from me.

When I was a kid I used to spend the summer holidays on my Uncle John and Aunt Nellie's farm. They grew both peaches and grapes. The peaches were harvested and dried and the grapes were turned into raisins and sultanas. Both were people of the land and both had a quiet dignity and caring nature.

One day, when I was about 7, I was in the kitchen with my Auntie and she had made two wonderful blackberry pies. She sat them on the window sill to cool. Suddenly a man appeared at the window. He was shabbily dressed and grubby of appearance and the following conversation ensued.

Tramp: G'day my dear lady. I am passing through and smelled that lovely pie. Might I have a little slice of it?
Auntie: You sure can. Come inside and I'll fix you a cup of tea.
Tramp: Kind of you Mrs., but I'm pretty dirty and must be on my way.
Auntie: Wait just a minute. Do you like ice cream?
Tramp: I certainly do.

Auntie Nellie went into the cupboard and pulled out a large paper plate, plastic knife and spoon and took one whole pie and  placed it on the plate adding three scoops of vanilla ice cream.

Auntie: There you are sir and may you enjoy it.
Tramp: I didn't mean for that much. I certainly will enjoy it and g'day to you and the boy. (With a sweep of his arm he turned and was off.)

I watched him as he walked down the dusty road that led out of the farm. There was a cool summer breeze and you could smell the wet soil caused by the irrigation water that flowed in between the rows of grape vines. I noticed as he walked away how his shoulders were hunched and he was obviously scooping up the ice cream and tasting the warm sweetness of the blackberries. I watched until he disappeared over the horizon or became the horizon.

Auntie: Are you alright Jackie?
Jack: Yea. Auntie I want to be a bum when I grow up and enjoy summer evenings and pies.
Auntie: There's more to life than that. You need to do something worthwhile and meaningful.
Jack: I guess you're right.

And Auntie Nellie was probably right, but there was many a time I envied that hobo who was free and alive and walking down dusty farm roads eating blackberry pies. But that was then and now is now.

Bum: Give me 4 bucks to get home to Bondi.

The other is trying to put his hand in some stooges pocket to get something for nothing and milk what he can out of the soft hearted and soft headed unfortunate enough to cross his path.

Till later.

Hi All,

Yes, I'm back for the moment. Did you miss me? I missed me!

Anyway, before I get started and tell you all about my time with Anna I need to get a few conceptual items out of the way so that the review will make sense.

First, it is important to define two terms that are highly relevant to understanding this punting experience. The first term I am referring to is 'gob-wiper'. Now, this may be a new term for some of you so I suggest that on the count of three we all say it out loud as a method of introducing it into our linguistic repertoire. Ready? One. . .two. . . three. . . GOB-WIPER! That felt good didn't it? Gob-wiper is defined as follows:

Gob-wiper: (Noun): A working lady who wipes her mouth using a tissue before during and after any event involving the lips. For example, she may wipe her mouth, kiss your cheek and wipe her mouth again. (Verb) To gob-wipe: The actual process of a working lady wiping her mouth e.g. 'She gob wiped for the fifth time'.

Wee-wee wiper: (Noun) A working lady who during the process of sucking on a penis will remove it from her mouth, wipe it with a tissue prior to reinserting it. (Verb) The actual process of wiping the penis with a tissue and reinserting it into her mouth. Example: 'She wee-wee wiped me incessantly'.

This comes from the fact that while most of us eat 'white bread' we hardly hanker after it. White bread is not seen as something that people are knowledgeable about nor invest much energy in exploring. For example, you are in a fancy restaurant, you know, one of those where there are no prices on the menu and you're sweating like a stuck pig because your credit card is already maxed out. If you look at the table next to you, you are hardly likely to hear the following conversation:

Waiter: (Arrives with a loaf of sliced white on a silver tray.) Please try it sir.
Patron; (Placing crumbs in gob.) Yes, Cole's generic bread. Wednesday, no Thursday morning bake.

Patron: Absolutely my good man.

Where was I? See the Anna's were so boring I forgot where I was.

She is a lovely lady and she did her best, but then again so did the baker who baked that white bread I had this morning.

Hi All, 

This review is about Mona, but before I get into it there are a few things I need to get off my chest.

First, my last electricity bill was a real shocker. It was enough to put me into cardiac arrest, but if I had I'd have died as I couldn't afford the juice required of the defibrillator to kick start my heart!

Second, I don't think I get the respect due me because I write reviews from the bottom of the sex industry. 

Now, let me be upfront. I love the upper end of the adult industry and the WL's there. God knows if I had my pockets bulging with dough I would be living full time in either Stilettos or Nirvana. I'd sublet the joints and be involved in doubles and triples 24/7.

I admit that the upper end places have a great ambience. Tiffany's, for example, has that wood panelling and The Gateway Club feels like an upmarket bar. In the rooms the lighting is the type that makes everybody look good and even ol' Jack looks like the picture on the left of this review. The showers are always clean and often have those little cakes of fragrant soap. The room itself has clean, fluffy towels and sweet smelling sheets. Its utopia folks.

I also admit that the ladies at the upper end are a true sight to behold. They are lovely, intelligent and can sting sentences together in ways that lead to interesting conversation and rapport. It's exciting to think that I am being 'intimate' with a woman who probably under most circumstances wouldn't give me the time of day. It's all really fabulous and is full of many of those Kodak moments that I often yearn for. (I am not sure if 'yearn' if the right word, perhaps 'crave' fits better.)

There's also the feeling at the top end of the market that I am special and a part of the elite. The ladies here are beautiful and young and unsullied and haven't had the filthy paws of the unwashed masses leaving their fingerprints all over them! It's kismet people!

Now the bottom end of the market is different. You don't see punters bragging that they went to 12 Bellevue or 295 Liverpool Rd. Ashfield. You're unlikely to hear the following exchange:

Jack: Hey Fred, I just spent an hour with Fatso at the Dung Heap Massage Parlour.
Fred: What was she like?
Jack: Fat, 50 plus, with a flabby belly, large Caesarean scar, no English and bad breath.
Fred: You're a lucky dog mate!

Everything at the bottom end is dodgy. It starts with the mamasan who lies through her teeth over the phone and continues on into the room. Typically they have .5 watt light bulbs here to disguise the fact the joint has never been cleaned. You worry when you take a shower and it's compounded when the lady gives you your 'clean' towel. (Note: If you're lucky you'll get a soap dispenser with generic soap, if not a used cake of Sunlight.)

The ladies at the bottom end have usually seen better days. Often they are Asian milfs trying to top up their superannuation before they are let out to pasture, English is a foreign tongue here and if there are mirrors on the walls they are cracked.

Yes, the bottom is frequented by the bums, hopeless and useless punters, but the ladies here are to be admired for the energy they put out and their service oriented attitude.
Where was I? Oh yes, Mona.

Mona is one of the original stars of Bellevue along with Sasa. A couple of years ago you'd easily call them the Pillars of Hercules, The Pillars of Hercules was the name given to the opening of the Mediterranean Sea. It was believed that travelling beyond them you entered the world of monsters. And so it was with Sasa and Mona.

Sasa and Mona had an 'I don't do list' that you could write on the back of a microchip in long hand. They were up for just about anything. They were the stars in 12 Bellevue. I had seen Sasa in those days, but typically Mona was all booked out and I only heard about her through reviews on forums where she was written up in glowing terms.

Well, on my arrival this time I was introduced to Mona in the line-up and felt I had to give her a go.

Mona is late 30's, pushing 40 with all her might. She has a bit of a tummy, lined face and b-cuppers.

Upon entering the room she began almost instantly with heavy doses of foam (fake comments, orgasm and moaning.) How on earth she expected me to react to her comments I'll never know, but I'll take a shot at it here:

Mona: You are so handsome Jack.
Jack: Yeah, that's why my wallet is full of pictures of me and I stand in front of the mirror all day.
Mona: You are so big!
Jack: Yep. My cock is 2.5 cm larger than the norm.
Mona: You make me so horny!
Jack: That's exactly what Angelina Jolie told me when I was with her.

Honestly, I don't know how to react to that stuff. I usually just sit back and think about how I'll work it into a review.

Now, Mona was not a bad punt, but wasn't a good one either. She had a lot of fucks on her clock and I think I was less than a blip on the radar screen of her life. She was on automatic pilot and what makes this even more  funny, so was I. It was all there i.e. mish, doggie and cowgirl, along with bbj, but it was all by the numbers.

G'day folks,

You know me by now. This review won't make much sense unless I give a little background information. Just hang with me and you'll see how all this stuff relates to my 'intimate' time with the lovely Jessica.

There are two important punting factors I need to highlight before my review. The first is the issue of punting time and the second revolves around lighting.

Time: That's the one thing none of us have an infinite amount of. In punting it is crucial and all participants are aware of it. Even working ladies who say they are not 'clock watchers' are, by that comment, indicating they are aware of time in the session. This is important as punters are literally paying dollars for minutes of activity and working ladies only have so many hours in the day to make a buck. Who can blame a working lady for wanting to shave a few minutes off each guy's session after slaving over hot cocks all day? I am sure many of these enchanting women feel they need to get a retread on their lips and 2,000 fuck service.

I am amazed how much the number 3 pops up in our lives in culture, religion and mythology.
I give you below a small list of some 3's we often encounter:

The Holy Trinity is said to comprise three aspects, The Father, Son and Holy Spirit.
Jesus at birth was visited by three Wise Men.
Jesus is said to have been crucified along with two others. (Three)
Jesus is said to have risen from the dead on the third day.
Peter denied Jesus 3 times before the cock crowed.
Three on a match is bad luck.
Let me make three things perfectly clear.
Would you photocopy this is triplicate?

The Phoenix rose from its ashes after three days.
Celebrity deaths occur in threes.

Hi All,

This is a review of Kylie and Susan.

Before I get into it I have to discuss the concept of the A-Team and the B-Team.

With all of these new digital channels the programmers have been skint for content. Hence, we see the resurrection on our airwaves of the A-Team TV series. It's a strange show and it's a wonder it attracted an audience in the first place, let alone over 30 years after most of the actors are dead.

These blokes in the A-Team appear to be able to do anything under the sun that involves killing people, but seem sadly lacking the acting stakes. George Peppard, the star of this monstrosity, spends most of the show taking humungous drags on his politically incorrect cigar. His offsider Mr. T looks for all the world like he couldn't spell his own surname and spends most of the time, in an random fashion, calling all in sundry "Fool!" It's all a bloody nightmare, but these clowns are supposed to be an elite unit that gets the job done. (Don't get me going on Airwolf with Jan-Michael Vincent and Ernest Borgnine. This dopey Yankee action series makes McHale's Navy look like Hamlet with Lawrence Olivier.)

In reality you know you wouldn't send this A-Team lot down to the newsagent to get you the Daily Telegraph so you could look up the adult section and plan your next punt. You know they'd get lost, manage to get hit by a bus and would have no health insurance. The A-Team is a ghastly bunch of nit-wits. 

Now, the movie the Dirty Dozen with Lee Marvin and Charles Bronson was a different kettle of fish. They were the B-Team and were nobody's first choice. These guys were different in that they could actually act. They were also real tough guys who didn't pay a hanger-on whose job it was to stub out their cigarettes. They did get the job done and with style. They were the B-Team and make the A-Team look like Mike Tyson did after Lennox Lewis got done with him.

Take care folks and remember, sometimes the action is where the B-Team resides.

Life, as they say, is a two edged sword. For every advantage in life there seems a corresponding debit.

You know there is an allure in being 'a regular' in aspects of life because when you are one, you are facing what is known.

Take as examples going regularly to McDonald's and KFC. Once you hit the front door you can tell by the decor you are in 'regular' territory. The familiar tacky seats and the over the top consumerism of it is well known. Add to this that the Big Mac tastes the same whether or not you get one at Central Station or out on a date with Holly of Albury while she tours Wagga Wagga. Nondescript:
"Someone or something that is nondescript looks very ordinary and is not at all interesting or unusual." 

It is obvious to me that this term applies to both Mimi and me.

I know I am nondescript. It all became apparent to me when teachers in primary school would always mark me absent even though 	I showed up for every class. In Year 12 I was voted by my graduating class as "Bloke most likely to become invisible." It was all demoralising.

Until later.

This is a review about Amy.

I remember the carnivals and how sleazy they were. Most of it was characterised by rip off ‘games’ where the sucker hoped to win a kewpie doll by throwing a ring over an item or shooting at and hitting targets. In cosmetic applications, a Botox injection, consisting of a small dose of botulinum toxin, can be used to prevent development of wrinkles by paralyzing facial muscles.

Botulinum is a neurotoxin which is used to decrease muscle activity by blocking the release of acetylcholine from the neuron by preventing the vesicle where the acetylcholine is stored from binding to the membrane where the neurotransmitter can be released. This will effectively weaken the muscle for a period of three to four months. 

It will also block neural messages from the effected area to the brain. 

Side affects in cosmetic use include dampening the relay of signals from the face to the amygdala and brainstem centers for autonomic arousal and thus affect the ability to process emotional feelings.

In April of 1968 I was sitting in a deuce and half truck in a convoy travelling outside of Kontum, South Vietnam on my way to Dak To in the central highlands. After about 20 minutes outside the city a sniper opened up on the lead truck. The convoy stopped and we all bailed out of the back of the truck seeking refuge in a nearby ditch. It was at that time that the rifle of Specialist 4 Ernesto Jiminez (pronounced ‘He-man-ez’), discharged a round into my helmet. Thankfully I was not wearing the helmet at the time. When that occurred the following conversation ensued:

Kerouac: Holy fuck what was that?
Jiminez: Sorry Lt. Kerouac my weapon accidently discharged.
Kerouac: You’re not supposed to have a round in the chamber and the safety should be ON!

I grabbed the rifle, removed the clip and ejected a live round that was in the chamber. I handed it back and told him to hold it by the barrel until we arrived at our destination.

Jiminez: Sorry Sir. It was an accident. I wasn’t trying to kill you.
Kerouac: You have no idea how much those words are a comfort to me.

After that time I christened him “Blam” Jim-an-ez.

I never disliked him. I forgave him that event that could have resulted in my demise. Why? Because in a world of often harsh cruelty he was a guy of sweet intention. He had several sisters and he used to give guys his sisters addresses so that they could get mail. The sisters all lived in Nuevo Laredo Mexico, but all were sweet and wrote gentle, innocent letters to those who wrote to them. Mail was everything in those days and Jim-an-ez reached out to others who were lonely and had no one who cared to write. I know he and his sisters saved lives in their own way. Maybe not saved physically, but psychologically.

When I think back on the hole blown in my helmet from that M 16, I smile knowing in the end when the sun went down that night ‘It was all good’.

To understand this punt you need to understand a bit of history.

As you Kerouac fans know I am originally from Lowell. Massachusetts and my family moved New York. I remember in my youth when the word service meant something. For example, in America they call petrol station 'gas' stations and usually service stations. In these places you'd put petro in your car and the attendant would check the oil and radiator level, tyre pressures, and wash your windshield (windscreen). Nowadays you have to do everything for yourself. The only guy who will wash your windscreen these days is some bludger at the lights with a dirty rag and a bucket of black coloured water. It's all self serve now buddy.

Service has disappeared everywhere. In department stores there used to be people who would help you and knew about the products. If you went ot a hardware store you could have a conversation like the following.

"I know what you're thinking. Did her fire six shots or only five? Well to tell you the truth in all this excitement I kinda lost track myself. Hi All,

This is a review of ‘New’ Sasa.

Before I let fly with my review about ‘New’ Sasa I need to make a distinction between two different types of new.

The first type of new is NEW. It is new in that it has not been used, possessed or abused prior to its encounter with a person. I remember this new when, years ago, the new model Oldsmobiles, Chevrolets and Studebakers would arrive in the showrooms in the Bronx in New York. My Dad would take me down to see those new models and they’d be all shiny, with clean motors, and that ‘new’ car smell, and a catwalk model standing next to them. It was exciting and little Jack Kerouac could imagine sitting behind the wheel of a brand new 1956 Chevy.

Being from a working class background, I was well familiar with another aspect of new. This ‘new’ meant that we had never had it before.  So for my family, in 1966, a 1959 Chevy Impala was ‘new’. It may have had a few dents in it and enough miles on the clock to take you to Alpha Centauri and back, but for the Kerouac family it was ‘new’.

Sometimes both these concepts of new would collide. So, for example, Brooke Waters was my ‘new’ girlfriend, but at 18 she had some mileage on her clock too. She used to live part time with her mother in Atlantic City and part time with her Dad in the Bronx. She used to fuck around a lot and the guys in my neighbourhood referred to her as ‘The Tail of Two Cities’.

I remember when she broke it off with me the other aspect of NEW came into play when the following conversation ensued.

Brooke: We should stop seeing each other.
Kerouac: Why?
Brooke: I don’t know. You don’t seem to make me laugh anymore.
Kerouac: I can learn new jokes.
Brooke: That’s not what I mean.
Kerouac: I can break in some new material that will make you laugh your socks off.
Brooke; It’s not the material. It’s your personality. It’s bland.
Kerouac: I can get a new personality.
Brooke: Jack?
Kerouac: Yes, Brooke.
Brooke: Piss off!

This brings us to ‘new Sasa.

Old Sasa used to be the head domo around this joint. She was reception and made sure all the girls came out like a bunch of rabid coyotes whenever a sucker, (Sorry for the typo), I mean punter walked through the door.

Well, Old Sasa had to go back to China and cried the last time I saw her. She wants to come back and if she can find a man with Australian citizenship, who will marry her, she will be in like Flynn in returning to our shores.

Well, I have to go now.

OK it would appear that you are unfamiliar with how easy it is to get our template.

It is easily found by members in the "Quick Reply" area on the "Formatting" line at the very end. There you will see a "drop down" menu titled "Templates" and you select the "Review Template" which will it bring up.

All you need to do is fill it in and then write your free flowing experience.

As to the additional data you have been supplying on face, body, skills etc I suggest that you include that in the  "Size/shape :" section. It adds value IMO.

I note that you have used your Template variant for some time so assume you may use a Word processor to write your reviews. All you need to do if that is the case is to substitute our one withg your former one.

Regards, Wotan010

Hi All,

This is a review of Amy.

Person's Name: Amy
Establishment: 12 Bellevue.
Date of Visit: April, 2015
Contact Details/Address/Weblink:  9281 8480
 Hours of Business: 10:00 am-2:00 am
 Rates: $65/30, $100/45, $130/60
 Age: Said 27, but I think more 37.
Size/shape: A bit  chubby
Nationality or Ethnicity: Chinese
Services Provided: Dfk, bbj with cim, anal.
Value for money/recommend?: Yes
My experience/comments: Seel below.

I am not posting so much lately because I am a bit jaded. (I know what you’re thinking, “Kerouac jaded? That’s about as profound as knowing Bill Shorten is a moron”.

Before I talk about Amy I need to give you a context. There are 4 things I don’t like about punting and all have been manifest at 12 Bellevue recently.

The first thing I don’t like involves Thai Jennifer. I have known her since she first started working in this establishment and she has been one of my favourites. That’s until I realised she does ‘overlapping’. What is ‘overlapping’? That’s when you book her for an hour and she books another punter to start 45 minutes later. Sure, she provides good service, but wants to knock you off in 45 minutes so that she can see the other bloke. I didn’t know about this as I usually finished a bit early, but on one occasion it was clear I would use the full  hour. She obviously got a text on her phone from the bloke waiting downstairs and tried her best to get me out of there. I cottoned on to what was going on bout and realised that in the past she was doing this to me all the time. Needless to say, she is off my Xmas card list and I have not seen her since. So, ‘overlapping’ is a form of time stealing.

The second thing I dislike is time wasting and Malisa would set the record for this. Malisa is mid to late 30’s with a reasonably pretty face. The first time I saw her she was fine, but on the repeat visit she took 5 minutes to go downstairs and get the change. She realised she forgot the towels and took 5 minutes to find them. She then took 3 minutes to go out and get tissues and finally took a 5 minute shower. I had already lost 18 minutes of my hour session. Add to all this that she moved in slow motion and everything was a chore requiring a deep sigh. I walked ot on this punt and got half my money back.

The third thing I dislike is the WL who does nothing and in all my punts Apple was the best at this. I had a double with her and YuYu and all she did was take off her clothes and sit on the edge of the bed taking to YuYu. I got so pissed off I got up and dressed while Apple laughed thinking this was all very funny. I asked for my money back for her part of the double and let YuYu keep her share as she was fine and getting on with things.

Finally, the fourth thing I dislike is management that is unresponsive to complaints. Tom the owner was not present during the Apple farce, but I sent him an email outlining what had happened and he has ignored me. This is not an effective method of holding on to regular customers.

Ok, jaded Jack has this out of his system.

Amy says she is 27, but I believe more 37, She has a roundish, pleasant face and trimmed pussy.. She has a bit of a tunny, B+-C- cups. She is a lovely lady who really tries to please. Her English is poor.

She does not take the initiative, but if you tell her what you want and treat her with respect she does her damnest to make you happy,

She is a good kisser. She did a pleasurable bbj and with the dom on I enjoyed her in cowgirl, doggie and mish. I asked or anal and that was fine with her. All in all, a good experience and I have seen her twice prior to this review.

She does have a disconcerting habit and that is when she perceives you’ve finished she does a no-frills goodbye and is quickly out the door.

Well, there you have it. I ventilated some of my pet peeves about punting and the pleasure of being with Amy.

May all your punts be great ones and may you never get ‘overlapping’, ‘time wasting’ and literally ‘do-nothing’ ladies.

I shall return. Take care and I will see you soon.

Until that time mates . . .until that time.

Uncle Jack

Fire at Surry Hills brothel Bellevue 12 treated as suspicious
Flames and smoke are seen at Surry Hills brothel Bellevue 12. Picture: David Ross
Flames and smoke are seen at Surry Hills brothel Bellevue 12. Picture: David Ross
DAVID ROSS
JOURNALIST

8:29PM MAY 30, 2020
A Surry Hills brothel that’s been closed since COVID-19 restrictions were introduced has been gutted by a blaze that’s being treated as suspicious.

The fire at Bellevue 12, in Sydney’s inner-city, broke out at 6.10pm in what police believe to be the property’s kitchen.

Emergency services respond to the fire at Bellevue 12 in Surry Hills. Picture: David Ross
Emergency services respond to the fire at Bellevue 12 in Surry Hills. Picture: David Ross
Five fire trucks and a large crane were required to extinguish the blaze, with crews cutting an entry to the rear of the property through a metal roller door and using ladders to climb into the locked building.


No one was injured, with police confirming the venue was empty at the time of the blaze.

Paramedics, NSW Police and detectives attended the scene, with investigations ongoing.

“Police arrived and the firefighters were already doing their thing,” Kings Cross Sergeant Lindsay McDonald told The Australian.

Two local residents were seen to be assisting police with their inquiries. Calls to the management of the brothel went unanswered.

Fire chief Richard Schembri said the source of the fire was unclear.

“It’s hard to tell back there, there lots of mattresses, lots of showers, and a lot of damage,” he said.
